p: The concept of protein misfolding disorder (PMD) is relevant for the understanding of the potential association of T2DM and PD. Protein misfolding disorders (PMD) are diseases caused by a protein or peptide that has been misfolded, aggregated, and accumulated in certain tissues. There are at least 30 different PMDs, including neurodegenerative, systemic, and metabolic disorders such as PD and T2DM [ 10].
